definitions.definition: A male given name from Spanish [in turn from Basque] .
A surname from Spanish [in turn from Basque] , found chiefly among people of Spanish and Portuguese descent.
Any of various notable people with this name as given name or surname, especially Saint Francis Xavier, a Spanish Catholic saint and missionary (1506–1552).

main_definition: A male given name from Spanish [in turn from Basque] .
secondary_definitions: A surname from Spanish [in turn from Basque] , found chiefly among people of Spanish and Portuguese descent.
Any of various notable people with this name as given name or surname, especially Saint Francis Xavier, a Spanish Catholic saint and missionary (1506–1552).
